member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether transitions are supported.

member.summary: Gets the synchronization lifecycle manager.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.SyncContext
member.summary: Gets the synchronization context.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.TriggerListSyncCompletionEvent
member.summary: Trigger an event when list synchronization is completed

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.HasChanged
member.summary: Explicitly set that the context has been changed.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.PushChanges(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Depending on the Transaction size, octopus decide when to commit. The first place where octopus do this is when the transaction size is reached for the existing objects, the second place is when when the transaction size is reached for the new objects, and the third time is when the sync is complete and the commit flag will be true.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.CreateNewInstance(System.Object)
member.summary: It will pass in the id value from the opposite side. Based on the mapping you can use this id or create a new object with a new id and assign the external id to a field.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.ClearChanges
member.summary: This is called when something fails and we need to rollback the changes. The adapter has to be Flushing in order this method to mean something.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.Dispose
member.summary: This is called in the end of the sync.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.GetNewEntries(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: GetNewEntries should return entries if the sort order for new entries is not well defined.
member.remarks: If the correlation id is calculable only on one side and the other side sets zero or null as value, the entries have to be returned by this method. In all other cases, the new entries are processed by the GetNextPage call and an empty list should be returned here.
member.param: The maximum amount of items to return. Used to reduce the memory consumption during sync.
The name of the correlation field. The paged results must be ordered by this column.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.GetItems(System.String,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: When the correlationField can not be reliably sorted then this methods should return the objects with the specified correlation field values. This is called until all the changed object are retrieved.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.GetItem(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the item by correlation field name.
member.exception: The Sitefinity adapter can only work with Guid. The correlation field name has to be the 'Id' property;Id

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.GetItemForUpsert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: This is update and insert. When the data comes only from the one side and going to the other and nothing more.
member.param: if you need to create a new object this the the Id value for the object, same for update.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.GetNextPage(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Returns items for sync comparison
member.remarks: This is the central entry point for the sync operation. Each adapter is asked to return the next set of items that should be processed by the sync operation. One field has been marked as correlation field. The correlation field value is used to correlated the data from the source and destination adapter. The values must be unique and sortable. The data is sorted by the correlation field (the name is passed in) and paged by the supported page size. The adapter is responsible to store all information to calculate the next page during the subsequent calls.
member.param: The maximum amount of items to return. Used to reduce the memory consumption during sync.
The name of the correlation field. The paged results must be ordered by this column.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.Insert(System.Object[])
member.summary: This method is used to insert new items that are coming from the other side.
member.param: This is always one object. The one created in the CreateNewInstance method.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.Update(System.Object[])
member.summary: This method is used to update items that are coming from the other side.
member.param: This is always one object. The one created in the CreateNewInstance method.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.Delete(System.Object[])
member.summary: This method is used to delete items that are coming from the other side.
member.param: This is always one object. The one created in the CreateNewInstance method.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.Delete(System.Tuple{System.Object,System.Object}[])
member.summary: ImportType.UploadMode this is going to delete everything in the current system based on the ids that are coming from the other side.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.BeginImport
member.summary: BeginImport is called before the sync process starts.
member.remarks: All required resources or configuration should be checked here. No configuration errors during the sync process should be generated if this method returned false.
member.returns: true if all necessary resources are configured right, false if not.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.BeginList(Telerik.OpenAccess.DataAdapter.Metadata.Description)
member.summary: List mapping specific initialization
member.param: The abstract metadata of the list that is going to be processed
member.remarks: InitializeList is called before a list synchronization is started. If a list specific initialization is needed, it should be implemented here.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Connectivity.Adapters.SitefinitySyncAdapterBase.EndList
member.summary: This method is called after each List in the mapping is processed
member.remarks: Any list specific cleanup should be implemented here.

member.summary: It will detect if the adapter has any changes or not.
